result.execSummary:
The defendant Mycal Rapheal Nealy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mycal Rapheal Nealy is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mycal Rapheal Nealy was found guilty of Theft (Value Not Exceeding $2,500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharges.
All mandatory costs, surcharges and assessment including the DNA surcharges to be paid by 24 MONTHS to convert to a civil judgment.
Court waived all non-mandatory costs.
Court set restitution at zero.
Consecutive to: any other sentence, TIME SERVED

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mycal Rapheal Nealy

defendant.name: Nealy, Mycal Rapheal

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mycal Rapheal Nealy in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Defendant Mycal Rapheal Nealy in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Serve 78 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 78 days, TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court set restitution at zero.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

All mandatory costs, surcharges and assessment (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by 24 MONTHS to convert to a civil judgment.
Court waived all non-mandatory costs.
Appeal rights given.

Attorney Allison Ritter in court, defendant Mycal Rapheal Nealy not in court, in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Allison Ritter was recently retained by the defendant and appears by phone means. Defense requests plea/sentencing hearing.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Mycal Rapheal Nealy
Current: 7601 W Beecher St Apt 1, West Allis, WI 53219 United States  (Effective: 06-16-2022)
Prior: 7123 West Silver Spring Drive, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Gail W.; Froedert Hosptial (except for the purpose of receiving treatment for a medical emergency of himself or a family member)
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Mycal Rapheal Nealy in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Mycal Rapheal Nealy in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mycal Rapheal Nealy appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:  Motion to dismiss by the defense for lack of probable cause, argued and GRANTED by the Court.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Defense requested date earlier than pretrial week.
This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
